CardPickup

Class GameMaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardPickup.GameMaster

  • public class GameMaster
extends java.lang.Object
    Pits Attacker and Defender agents against one another in the name of Science! STUDENTS: add your Player to the sections in main that say "add Players here". Also add your defender to the getPlayer() method. You may also want to edit the Parameters in the changeParameters() method when testing. Trust that these values will be changed when the full tournament is run.

    • Method Detail

      • initializePlayers

        public static void initializePlayers(Graph g,
                     PlayerProfile p1Profile,
                     Player p1,
                     PlayerProfile p2Profile,
                     Player p2,
                     int gameSeed)
        Initializes each player and each player profile with all the relevant knowledge needed to start a game
        Parameters:
        g - copy of graph
        p1Profile - profile for player 1
        p1 - player 1
        p2Profile - profile for player 2
        p2 - player 2
        gameSeed - seed for the game

      • runMatches

        public static Hand[] runMatches(int gameSeed,
                java.lang.String p1Name,
                java.lang.String p2Name)
        Runs a specified number of matches on the same graph against two players. One match is considered 2 rounds where the second round reverses the locations and hands of the 2 players.
        Parameters:
        gameSeed - number representing the seed used to generate the graph
        p1Name - The player that will act first in the first round of a match (will act as player 2 in the second round)
        p2Name - The player that will act second in the first round of a match (will act as player 1 in the first round)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Runs the tournament
        Parameters:
        args - not using any command line arguments

      • generateGraphs

        public static void generateGraphs(int numGraphs)
        Generates graphs
        Parameters:
        numGraphs - the number of graphs to generate

      • getPlayer

        public static Player getPlayer(java.lang.String name)
        You should edit this method to include your player agent
        Parameters:
        name - The name of your player agent
        Returns:
        An instance of your Player agent
